result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Snipes

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Letter from Attorney Tapia requesting either an adjournment or an earlier date for the motion hearing in this case.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/21/2022 - Approved.**

10:04 AM Defendant Calvin Snipes in court.  Attorney Angela Wang appears on behalf of Ricardo Tapia in court for Calvin Snipes.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
Defense requests a Motion Hearing to address Atty Tapia's Motion to Dismiss and brief.
State may respond within 2 weeks. 
Defense would then have 1 week to reply.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss the Criminal Complaint

11:04 AM Defendant Calvin Snipes in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Tapia requests another status in 30 days as he plans to file a Motion re: footage. Court sets status.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:15 AM Defendant Calvin Snipes in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Tapias states he is still awaiting electronic discovery and requests another status date.
The State has no objection.
The Court will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:08 AM 
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Calvin Snipes in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia. 

Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendants waiver of prelim.
Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.
Bail remains as fixed.
Information filed  Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waived reading and enters a Not Guilty Plea.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Search Warrant
Endorsement on Warrant
Return of Officer
Affidavit
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ricardo Tapia has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

04:09 PM Defendant Calvin Snipes in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
